TopicTitle: Am I the only one feel uncomfortable about the different white of new "S4" tanks?

Articles.Content:
Making History DLC brings us the new S4 tanks which is cool, only if they made its white matches the old grayish white.

https://photos.app.goo.gl/oisxcTuCMiGQptTh1

Edited March 25, 2018 by HeleleMama
typo
No, you're not.  And if you look, the new tanks have two different shades of black too.

6 hours ago, DerekL1963 said:

No, you're not.  And if you look, the new tanks have two different shades of black too.

Damn, you shouldn't told me the black is not right too.  

Now I'm even more uncomfortable.

Help me! Is there a texture mod??

Just adding to KSP's artistic geology.  You'd think they'd have an art bible at this point.

Just looked at the picture.  How did that make it in the game...  Back to my modded 1.3.1.  You all enjoy the new "features."

Edited March 27, 2018 by klgraham1013
Oh great. Now I know this and can't stop noticing. ARGHHHHH

I prefer the clean white look of the new parts. I was never fond of the "repurposed junk yard parts" look of early KSP parts or even the cleaner grayish ones. Over time KSP parts have gotten better, I just see this as being the next stage. With the texture flipping function I think they should just add more textures so everyone can choose their preference. Kerbal grey,  NASA white and black, bare metal and cryogenic orange at the very least should be available for all tanks.

3 hours ago, EatVacuum said:

I prefer the clean white look of the new parts. I was never fond of the "repurposed junk yard parts" look of early KSP parts or even the cleaner grayish ones. Over time KSP parts have gotten better, I just see this as being the next stage. With the texture flipping function I think they should just add more textures so everyone can choose their preference. Kerbal grey,  NASA white and black, bare metal and cryogenic orange at the very least should be available for all tanks.

Agree...

Making those variations available for every parts(including old ones) is very appreciated.     My point is, they should at least match with each other first before either cleaner or dirtier. 

Personally, I prefer the now existing MK3 style. It's not old, but more detailed and rich. 

If you take a closer look, you will find the new parts' texture is actually less detailed and even very rough at some point. For some parts, they don't even get the resolution right.
